name: Barium iodide
desc: Barium iodide is an inorganic compound with the formula BaI2. The compound exists as an anhydrous and a hydrate (BaI2(H2O)2), both of which are white solids. When heated, hydrated barium iodide converts to the anhydrous salt. The hydrated form is freely soluble in water, ethanol, and acetone.
Other anions:
barium fluoride
barium chloride
barium bromide
Other cations:
beryllium iodide
magnesium iodide
calcium iodide
strontium iodide
